channel.title: Flat 29's Big Book of Everything
channel.description: Comedy podcast cataloguing and discussing the contents of our universe
channel.itunes:author: Flat 29
channel.itunes:subtitle: A fortnightly comedy podcast cataloguing and discussing the contents of our universe, tackling a different subject in every chapter, each featuring a brand new comedy song.
channel.itunes:summary:
Flat 29's Big Book of Everything is a fortnightly comedy podcast cataloguing and discussing the contents of our universe. Every other week a new chapter is released tackling a new and exciting subject.
Full of useless trivia, rambling anecdotes, ludicrous discussions, and a new comedy song in every chapter, Flat 29's Big Book of Everything is an enjoyable way to expand your knowledge about everything (as long as you currently know nothing at all about anything)
channel.itunes:keywords: flat 29, flat29, comedy songs, comedy music

item.title: Chapter 41 - Food
item.description: For this mega-chapter of Flat 29's Big Book of Everything we are joined by Sara Davis of podcast How Much Do We Love, and Emily Davis (no relation) who you will have heard in various guises in loads of previous Flat 29 podcast chapters. With these excellent dudes, we talk about phones in potatoes, calling your eggs and eating pizzas round your neck.
item.itunes:author: Flat 29
item.itunes:subtitle: For this mega-chapter of Flat 29's Big Book of Everything we are joined by Sara Davis of podcast How Much Do We Love, and Emily Davis (no relation) who you will have heard in various guises in loads of previous Flat 29 podcast chapters. With these excellent dudes, we talk about phones in potatoes, calling your eggs and eating pizzas round your neck.
item.itunes:summary: For this mega-chapter of Flat 29's Big Book of Everything we are joined by Sara Davis of podcast How Much Do We Love, and Emily Davis (no relation) who you will have heard in various guises in loads of previous Flat 29 podcast chapters. With these excellent dudes, we talk about phones in potatoes, calling your eggs and eating pizzas round your neck.
item.itunes:keywords: Flat 29, Flat29, food

item.title: Fistbumpin' Episode 1 - Technology
item.description: The first episode of Flat 29's new sketch show FISTBUMPIN' includes an urgent campaign to Get Dads Online, comedy folk band The Wurzels living beyond their means, and Charlie wearing his heart on his sleeve, only to have it steamrollered by Dan and Rich's techno locomotion.
item.itunes:author: Flat 29
item.itunes:subtitle: The first episode of Flat 29's new sketch show FISTBUMPIN' includes an urgent campaign to Get Dads Online, comedy folk band The Wurzels living beyond their means, and Charlie wearing his heart on his sleeve, only to have it steamrollered by Dan and Rich's techno locomotion.
item.itunes:summary: The first episode of Flat 29's new sketch show FISTBUMPIN' includes an urgent campaign to Get Dads Online, comedy folk band The Wurzels living beyond their means, and Charlie wearing his heart on his sleeve, only to have it steamrollered by Dan and Rich's techno locomotion.
item.itunes:keywords: Flat 29, Flat29, sketch comedy, technology

item.title: Chapter 40 - Technology
item.description: In the first Chapter of Volume 3 of our Big Book of Everything, we identify the Novelty Homer Simpson Bottle Opener as the best item to have in the event of a nuclear holocaust, Rich throws sticky orange drinks all over the queen, and we invent an app for remotely neglecting a dog while staring into its sad, sad eyes.
item.itunes:author: Flat 29
item.itunes:subtitle: In the first Chapter of Volume 3 of our Big Book of Everything, we identify the Novelty Homer Simpson Bottle Opener as the best item to have in the event of a nuclear holocaust, Rich throws sticky orange drinks all over the queen, and we invent an app for remotely neglecting a dog while staring into its sad, sad eyes.

item.itunes:keywords: Flat 29, Flat29, technology

item.title: Chapter 39 - Not Albums
item.description: This may not be Flat 29's Big Book of Everything Chapter 39 - Albums, but it does contain instructions on how to get it! Simply go to flat29.com, click on Music, and buy our new album SECRET HANDSHAKE for music, extras, and the elusive podcast chapter 39!

item.title: Dan's Xmas Mixtape 2011
item.description: Another bonus podcast to keep you going until the start of Big Book of Everything Volume Three! Dan's Xmas Mixtape 2011 features Dan of Flat 29 with his brother Tristan talking about melting down plastic toys into a swimming pool, knitting a liquorice jumper, and a bit about christmas music too. Also features a forced confirmation of when the new podcast series will start, and a brand new Flat 29 Christmas song!
item.itunes:author: Flat 29
item.itunes:subtitle: Another bonus podcast to keep you going until the start of Big Book of Everything Volume Three! item.itunes:keywords: Flat 29, Flat29, christmas music, christmas mixtape

item.title: Live For Pride 48 In Las Vegas
item.description: In this LIVE chapter on Las Vegas, Digital Dan and Robot Rich talk us through the etiquette of giving your own eulogy at an inpromptu Las Vegas funeral, and explain why George Clooney looks like the sort of man who would operate a fairground attraction. Meanwhile Charlie pops in to marry his father. All in glouriously variable audio quality!
item.itunes:author: Flat 29
item.itunes:subtitle: In this LIVE chapter on Las Vegas, Digital Dan and Robot Rich talk us through the etiquette of giving your own eulogy at an inpromptu Las Vegas funeral, and explain why George Clooney looks like the sort of man who would operate a fairground attraction. Meanwhile Charlie pops in to marry his father. All in glouriously variable audio quality!

item.itunes:keywords: Flat 29, Flat29, pride 48, pride48, lgbt

item.title: Chapter 38 - Children
item.description: In this, the final chapter of Volume Two of our Big Book of Everything, we selflessly become superstar DJs to serve our country, Rich reprises his role as Santa in his school play, and we replace the toys in Kinder Surprises with a line of bleak poetry to teach children about the futility of life.
item.itunes:author: Flat 29
item.itunes:subtitle: In this, the final chapter of Volume Two of our Big Book of Everything, we selflessly become superstar DJs to serve our country, Rich reprises his role as Santa in his school play, and we replace the toys in Kinder Surprises with a line of bleak poetry to teach children about the futility of life.
item.itunes:summary: In this, the final chapter of Volume Two of our Big Book of Everything, we selflessly become superstar DJs to serve our country, Rich reprises his role as Santa in his school play, and we replace the toys in Kinder Surprises with a line of bleak poetry to teach children about the futility of life.
item.itunes:keywords: Flat 29, Flat29, comedy music, children, on the wonk

item.title: Chapter 37 - Work
item.description: In this chapter, we take an open top bus load of tourists through a labyrinth to slay a minotaur and help us bond as a team, Rich writes a self help book mostly fully of Sudokus, and we build up a Christmas army to help us storm Santa's castle, deck the elves, and save Christmas. Or destroy it. We can't remember which. Also features a game of On The Wonk with Jason from The Milk Bar podcast and Dan's brother Tristan.
item.itunes:author: Flat 29
item.itunes:subtitle: In this chapter, we take an open top bus load of tourists through a labyrinth to slay a minotaur and help us bond as a team, Rich writes a self help book mostly fully of Sudokus, and we build up a Christmas army to help us storm Santa's castle, deck the elves, and save Christmas. Or destroy it. We can't remember which. Also features a game of On The Wonk with Jason from The Milk Bar podcast and Dan's brother Tristan.

Or destroy it. We can't remember which. Also features a game of On The Wonk with Jason from The Milk Bar podcast and Dan's brother Tristan.
item.itunes:keywords: Flat 29, Flat29, comedy music, work

item.title: Chapter 36 - Sexy
item.description: In the sexiest of chapters, charlie leads an angry mob, rich changes fashion to make the crotch more accessible, and we discuss the eternal question whats better - flexi time or sexy time. We also play a game of work-in-progress quiz On The Wonk with Colin and Matt from Amazing Radio's The Saturday Show.
item.itunes:author: Flat 29

item.itunes:keywords: Flat 29, Flat29, comedy music, sexy

item.title: Chapter 35 - Crime
item.description: In this chapter we convince Martin Bashir to take up a new career as a cashier, introduce a complicated pay and display system whereby you share your science project in lieu of money, and launch a range of savory scondiments, perfect accompaniments to your favourite savory scones. Also includes the semi successful debut of new wonk-based quiz, On The Wonk. So have a listen! Or, as a nice lady once shouted at Rich... what's the matter, don't you like fun?
item.itunes:author: Flat 29
item.itunes:subtitle: In this chapter we convince Martin Bashir to take up a new career as a cashier, introduce a complicated pay and display system whereby you share your science project in lieu of money, and launch a range of savory scondiments, perfect accompaniments to your favourite savory scones. item.title: Chapter 34 - Literature
item.description: In this chapter Rich shares an intermittently sexy cockney story, a Stephen Fry lookalike mouths audiobooks at us as we drift off to sleep, and guest host Tristan presents his new angle-based chat show, On The Wonk.
item.itunes:author: Flat 29
item.itunes:subtitle: In this chapter Rich shares an intermittently sexy cockney story, a Stephen Fry lookalike mouths audiobooks at us as we drift off to sleep, and guest host Tristan presents his new angle-based chat show, On The Wonk.

item.itunes:keywords: Flat 29, Flat29, comedy music, literature, reading, books, on the wonk

item.title: Chapter 33 - Time
item.description: In this chapter we give historical heroes a reassuring tickle, Rich dreams of impressing his family with a cup and ball trick, and we investigate ways of hiring the concept of maths into our ever expanding staff. And rumour has it there may be some news as to the fate of a certain time travelling professor..

item.title: Chapter 32 - BORING
item.description:
In this chapter Flat 29 share their boring passions in an effort to convert one and other to their boring way of life. Rich looks at - but never touches - electrical leads, Charlie talks about the decline of CD sales in too much detail, and Dan's passion for software updates confuses and terrifies all.
To download songs and extra clips for free, visit flat29.com/podcast

item.title: Chapter 31 - Sleep
item.description:
In this chapter Charlie imagines a life where his dad is a cup of tea, Rich tries to get a drugged up owl back on the straight and narrow, and Dan overenthusiastically promotes Sleeping Lunches, or Slunches, in which office workers cuddle up with a colleague, selected at random every lunchtime, after a tough mornings work.
To download songs and extra clips for free, visit flat29.com/podcast

item.title: Chapter 30 - The Internet
item.description:
In this chapter we send drawings of items we have bought on ebay to their previous owners, enjoy an orchestral arrangement of the dialup modem theme, and a teenage Rich googles David Bowie, while unbenownst to him, David Bowie googles him right back.
To download songs and extra clips for free, visit flat29.com/podcast!

item.title: Chapter 29 - Live Music
item.description:
In this chapter we write a host of songs about spreadsheets, make sure we are getting our high-five-a-day, and Paul McCartney ruins Rich's bag - for life. The chapter closes with a 20 minute live performance of our own, recorded at Dans brothers engagement party!
To download songs and extra clips for free, visit flat29.com/podcast!

item.title: Chapter 28 - Fairytales
item.description:
In this chapter we learn why ripping out the hearts of humans (or giants) is currently banned in Norway, why Peter Jackson executed an egg a day with an antique revolver during the filming of Lord of the Rings, and why Merlin's abseiling skills mean he will never be invited to rich's wedding.
To download songs and extra clips for free, visit flat29.com/podcast!

item.title: Chapter 27 - Birth
item.description: In this chapter we plan out our ideal births, situated on the disused site of the "Neverland" theme park, and accompanied by celebrity sibling Julian Roberts and a rabid monkey. We also form a band consisting of our nieces and nephews wearing masks of their older selves.

item.title: Flat 29's Twelve Days of Xmas
item.description: In Flat 29's Big Book of Everything's Christmas Special 2010, we count down 12 christmas items on our minds this holiday season, all whilst wearing our auto-tune ties, PVA Nutsuits, and strings of superman's-eyes-staring-into-your-very-soul-Poundland-LED Christmas Lights. Happy holiday times everyone!

item.title: Chapter 26 - Spies
item.description: In this voyerISTIC chapter, we train up some aprentice spies by assigning them to spy on an ant, help James Bond sneak a Twix into a bad guy's hollowed out volcano lair, and examine the many and varied jobs carried out by Steve Jobs, including miner, french resistance spy, and breakfast technician.

item.title: Chapter 25 - Cooking
item.description: In this chapter we plan a diet regime based around food confiscated from children, stir things up with a game of popular quiz Guess The Utensil, and present a reading from The Gospel According to Tony the Tiger. In his own sacred words, its grrrrreat.
item.itunes:author: Flat 29

item.title: Chapter 24 - Agriculture
item.description: In this manure-ridden chapter, we find out which of us has The Tractor Factor, Dan gets rather too much enjoyment from a goat licking his hand, and after lovingly raising our cows to adulthood, we coldly shoot them at point blank range. Because we are farmers, and farming has peaks and troughs (for the pigs)
item.itunes:author: Flat 29

item.title: The Time Travelling Musical Adventures of Sherlock Holmes: The Musical
item.description: Flat 29 proudly present a feature length musical adventure starring everyone's favourite crime solving time travelling duo - Sherlock Holmes and Professor Winston. To celebrate another successful lecture, Winston has taken his class out for dinner at his eatery of choice, the chicken based restaurant Nandos. But after one piri piri sauce too many his robotic digestive system starts playing up, forcing him on a calamitous adventure through time to find the only possible cure for his affliction. But will he find an answer before it is too late? Or has Professor Winston said his last awwwwww shucks?
item.itunes:author: Flat 29
item.itunes:subtitle: Flat 29 proudly present a feature length musical adventure starring everyone's favourite crime solving time travelling duo - Sherlock Holmes and Professor Winston.
item.itunes:summary: Flat 29 proudly present a feature length musical adventure starring everyone's favourite crime solving time travelling duo - Sherlock Holmes and Professor Winston. item.itunes:keywords: Flat 29, Flat29, comedy musical, comedy songs, musical theatre, sherlock, winston, time travel

item.title: Chapter 23 - The Orchestra
item.description:
In this chapter, Rich details his illustrious musical (and sporting) career, Dan invalidates the warranty on his gas tank, and popular new character 'Professor Sausage' is born.. and subsequently killed off all within a minute…it's probably for the best!
You can find all our other shows and songs, at flat29.com/podcast. Visit flat29.com and click CD Downloads to buy some of our CDs and support the show! Or just click "Vacancies" for a list of openings in the flat 29 orchestra!

item.title: Chapter 22 - Fitness
item.description:
In this episode we perform an emergency malteser tracheomety, punch a weetabix soldier in his soggy face, and issue some sage advice to fishermen concerning where and when they can lick their fish. We also pop into the steam room to chat to talk fitness Ben and Dave from Ben and Dave's Six Pack.
You can find all our other shows and songs, at flat29.com/podcast. Visit flat29.com and click CD Downloads to buy some of our CDs and support the show!

item.title: Chapter 19 - Men
item.description:
In this manly chapter, we schedule in our BMDs (Beard Maintinence Days), Rich's fictional aunt and uncle elope to Wales, and spot a strong correlation between the size of spider you find in your house and the vegetables you have been eating that day.
You can find extras for this podcast, along with all our other shows and songs, at flat29.com/podcast

item.title: Special - Live for Pride 48
item.description:
In our first ever live show, we caught up with the exciting adventures of Sherlock Holmes and Professor Winston, Charlie finally attempted to fake a cake on the make, and Rich was kind enough to make us all omelettes! They tasted funny.
You can find extras for this podcast, along with all our other shows and songs, at flat29.com/podcast

item.description: To celebrate the world cup, in this chapter we drape ourselves in stingrays and are acompanied to the pub by a couple of bees, the ancient Romans, and various aptly named CEOs. All the while, goalkeeper David Seamen does something predictably disgusting.
